info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 8:10AM CDT until May 1 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
North Canadian River at Oklahoma City at Britton Road affecting Oklahoma County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...North Canadian River at Oklahoma City at Britton Road.
* WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Low-lying croplands and pastures east of Oklahoma City near the towns of Spencer and Jones may be briefly flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
